intro: Mesostemma dichotomum var. lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceolate mesostemma, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and distinctive branching pattern. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. This variety is notable for its unique morphology and ecological adaptations to its native habitat.
